data.title: Leisurely Breakfast
data.text: The wait staff was friendly, atmosphere was pleasant, everything was clean, food was prepared well and served piping hot. Endless coffee.....

data.title: Unless you are a regular go elsewhere
data.text: This Pegah's has been in buisness for many years and caters to its regular coustomers. If the wiat staff doesn't know your face, don't expect to be served promptly. They dote on their regular customers and spend time socializing at their tables, while you wait to order. The food is just ok, lots of standard breakfast items, and run of the mill menu items. The 'fresh fruit' is fruit cocktail- even in the summer. They will not allow substituons of any kind. The customer is not always right here- unless you are a regular

data.title: Typical diner type food. Atmosphere is a bit nicer.
data.text: Typical diner type food. The staff is friendly. Owners/manager are on site. They really excel at breakfast foods. Try their french toast.

data.title: Ah breakfast all day
data.text: I always eat breakfast here the International Omelet is the best, my wife enjoys the meat loaf, always great food and good service, never miss an opportunity to eat here

data.title: Great "Home Style" food
data.text: Pork Chops, Meatloaf, Hot roast beef sandwich, chicken dumplings, homemade soups, and great breakfast menu!!

data.title: Good food for a fair price.
data.text: Pehah's has a nice variety of food. The staff is friendly and provides  good service. Has a family atmosphere. My wife and I eat there weekly.

data.title: Good home cooking!
data.text: Diner atmosphere! burgers, fries, salads, tenderloin sandwich, pretty good prices. Oh and don't get me started on this place and there is pies. So good ! Come check it out. They are fast if your on your lunch break! Couple locations in Johnson county! Been to the one on 87th in Lenexa, KS. Google it!

data.title: Always heard good things.
data.text: Great family restaurant with a homey fill. Service was fast and very friendly. Food was awesome. I'm one that doesn't mind paying a little more just so I get enough to eat. The price was great and we got a ton of food. I had a really good chicken sandwich with bacon cheese barbecue  sauce tomato and a pineapple on it. Sweet potatoes fries to top it off. Refilled my drink 3 or 4 times. My wife had two huge wraps. Took half of it to lunch to eat the next day. Going back soon for breakfast.

data.title: Wonderful choices
data.text: this is a place which offers a great variety  of food, all of which is well-prepared and tasty.   Prices are very moderate.  Service is good.n

data.title: Breakfast with friends
data.text: We live eating at all three Pegah's restaurants in Johnson county. They have breakfast all day with lunch and dinner later in the day.

data.title: Old School Dining
data.text:
Took a friend here for her birthday on a Tuesday around noon.  We both ordered the hot roast beef sandwich as you rarely find that on menus these days.  We were both disappointed by the quality of the roast beef---rather leather-like.  The gravy was thin, the potatoes hopefully were real, not sure.  It was only $8.99, so perhaps you get what you pay for.  Fortunately, the dessert was very, very good---german chocolate cake, just like my mom used to make.  And a large portion!   We will give Pegah's another try another time.  Perhaps their breakfasts are better.  

The waitress was not especially friendly or helpful. All the waitresses seemed a little bored with their job.

data.title: Chocolate chip pancakes
data.text: Fairly quick seating on Sunday morning, decent selection, good service.  The chocolate chip pancakes were awesome, LOTS of chocolate inside.  This is a local,  home-cooking, cafe type restaurant.  Clean and friendly.

data.title: It's OK.
data.text:
Pretty standard stuff. Good for breakfast. Lunch and dinners are not terrible, but not something to write home to Mother either. 
Nothing really wrong with it, just a typical diner. Does have a meeting room

data.title: No Service
data.text: We went to Pegah's expecting the same friendly service as before. I'm am extremely disappointed that upon entering the "greeter" just looked at us & another couple behind us & then just went back to shuffling menus. The couple behind us asked my family if we are to seat ourselves, I replied, "They are to seat us." So the lady asked the "greeter"  unless you came with the party that just came in you will need to be seated. Then she went back to the menus. After another minute she then asked how many in our party & took us to a booth in the back. She gave us menus & never showed any hospitality or stated your waiter will be with you in a moment......We Sat in our Booth for 20 MINUTES & not once did the multiple waiters acknowledge us verbally or visually. They continued to walk back & forth asking other tables directly adjacent & behind us if they were okay or needed anything else. After 20 minutes (way too long), my family & I got up to take our business elsewhere. There was absolutely NO customer service, & the teenagers working did not seem to know what they wete doing and were delivering food to the wrong tables. This combined with a lack of friendliness of just simply stating, "I'll be with you in just a moment," is unacceptable. This was a very unpleasant, disheartening visit & experience & we WILL NOT be returning.

data.title: Friendly staff and great food
data.text: For delicious and inexpensive food with a warm atmosphere, Pegah's is the place to go.  Great variety of food items for breakfast, lunch or dinner.

data.title: Simply my favorite breakfast in town
data.text: We've been going to Pegah's for years at multiple locations here in Shawnee.  We've always appreciated the service and the food is just the perfect breakfast approach.  We've now got waitresses that know what our order is just by seeing us!  This will always be part of my regular routine.

data.title: Home cooked greatness
data.text: This is a must do - don't be fooled by the name or the loks - this is great home cooked food - you would swear your grandma is in the back cooking it.  Prices can't be beat either.  Breakfast all day.  Best liver in onions I have ever had.  LOVE it.

data.title: Surprisingly good!
data.text: Decided to try Pegah's for breakfast on a Sunday morning.  Living in Shawnee, see that Pegah's is ALWAYS busy.  We were pleasantly surprised at how good the food is!  Had french toast and eggs - was very good. The biscuits and gravy were decent (biscuits were hard).  But overall - we really enjoyed the food. The service was good and it was packed full of families.

data.title: One of the few places in Jo Co for southern comfort foods
data.text: As Donny & Marie used to sing back in the day, I'm a little bit country. While I've always lived in the city, I like good ol' country food. Pegah's didn't disappoint me. My husband thought the chicken portions were small, but I had gravy! My world was good! The kids were happy. The server was friendly. And the pie was DIVINE ! ! (I won't give away their secret, which was shared by the server.)  But I highly recommend the pecan pie, & I've heard the others are good as well. We've dined at the Lenexa & Shawnee locations & I have to say, Shawnee Pegah's has Lenexa beat for great taste. I thought the prices were a little high, but I'm thankful there's still a place in the suburbs that serves real veggies and a home-cooked taste. Thank you, Pegah's!

data.title: Good!
data.text: Pegah's is a good old fashioned family restaurant. Good home cooked food. Friendly staff. A great place for the whole family.
